content.prompt: Which statement explains one way in which the transformation of India’s economy contradicts Wallerstein’s world system theory?

choices.label: As a British colony, India functioned as a peripheral region supplying resources to benefit the core.
Using a development strategy to avoid economic dependency, India has been able to develop its own industries and participate fully in the global economy.
The outsourcing of high-tech jobs with high wages to India by U.S. companies is not economic exploitation because the jobs are high paying.
India’s ethnically, linguistically, and religiously diverse populations serve as centrifugal forces, preventing India from participating in the global economy.
India’s emphasis on nonalignment with and isolation from the Heartland has limited the country’s role in supranational organizations and international decision-making.
